isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - ADJUSTMENTS - DOOR HALF OF HINGE (AFTER DECEMBER 5, 1994)

svcproc.title: DOOR HALF OF HINGE (AFTER DECEMBER 5, 1994)
svcproc.para: Adjust door forward or back at a sliding tapped mounting/adjustment plate (Item 3, Figure 53) inside the door through mounting bolt access holes (Item 2, Figure 54) in the door panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. TORX HEAD HINGE STOP REST BOLT
3. TORX HEAD HINGE STOP REST BOLT

step1.para: Remove door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Remove.

If door trim panel removed, remove tape (Item 1, Figure 55) or, if no door trim panel, remove access hole plugs (Item 2, Figure 55) covering mounting bolt access holes (Item 2, Figure 54) in the door panel at upper and lower hinges.

figure.caption: Figure 55. Replace Tape or Re-install Access Hole Plugs

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. TAPE OVER ACCESS HOLES (WITH TRIM PANEL)

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 54for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Using a torx head tool, slightly loosen torx head hinge stop rest bolt (Item 3), one hinge at a time.
Slightly loosen flanged head mounting bolts (Item 1), two each hinge, one hinge at a time.
Move door forward or back as required to obtain proper door position.

Once door adjustment is made, hold door in place. First tighten flanged head mounting bolt (Item 1) nearest the torx head stop rest bolt (Item 3), both in same access hole. Then tighten the other flanged head mounting bolt (Item 1), in separate access hole. Use a torx head tool to tighten torx head hinge stop rest bolt. Tighten flanged head and torx head bolts to 20 to 28 ft-lbs. (27 to 38 Nm).
Once the first hinge is adjusted, repeat this procedure to adjust the other hinge.

After both hinges have been adjusted, close door and check for proper fit. If further adjustment is required, repeat this procedure. If door adjustment is all right, replace tape (Item 1, Figure 55) or, if no door trim panel, reinstall access hole plugs (Item 2, Figure 55) covering hinge mounting bolt access holes (Item 2) in the door panel at upper and lower hinges.
Install door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Install.
